findings.title: OathForge contract doesn't track of its token fracturizer
findings.description: The OathForge contract lacks tracking mechanisms for its token fracturizer and does not check if a voting process is already underway for a particular token, allowing anyone to deploy a RiftPact contract corresponding to any tokenId even if it doesn't exist.

findings.title: submitRedemptionCodeHash() doesn't check if sunset length reached or not at the time of redemption
findings.description: The function submitRedemptionCodeHash() fails to verify whether the sunset length has been reached during the redemption process.

findings.title: Use pause() Function or Pausable library
findings.description: It will be very helpful if in any situation you need to stop functionalities of contract that can be done by using pausable library for both contracts.

findings.title: ERC20 Riftpact token contract doesn't contain symbol and name
findings.description: The ERC20 Riftpact token contract is missing public variables for name and symbol which can be read by Etherscan and wallet.

findings.title: initiateSunset() can be done before minting
findings.description: Should check if token is minted or before initiate sunset.

findings.title: Reentrancy issue in submitBid() function
findings.description: The submitBid() function of RiftPact token contract contains a Reentrancy issue, externally calling DAI token contract and transferring tokens to previous bidder, and updating states after external calls.

findings.title: Unprotected safeTransferfrom() Function
findings.description: The transferfrom() function checks for sunsetInitialise, but users can still use the safeTransferfrom() function to transfer tokens even after the sunset length has been exceeded in OathForge Contract.
